meta.dc:title: HR 2334 ENR: To designate the Department of Veterans Affairs community-based outpatient clinic in Odessa, Texas, as the “Wilson and Young Medal of Honor VA Clinic”.

meta.property: One Hundred Sixteenth Congress of the United States of America
To designate the Department of Veterans Affairs community-based outpatient clinic in Odessa, Texas, as the “Wilson and Young Medal of Honor VA Clinic”.

main.name: HR2334

content.p: To designate the Department of Veterans Affairs community-based outpatient clinic in Odessa, Texas, as the “Wilson and Young Medal of Honor VA Clinic”.

main.enactingFormula: Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,

section.heading: Designation of Wilson and Young Medal of Honor VA Clinic.

subsection.heading: Finding.—
subsection.content: Congress finds that Private First Class Alfred “Mac” Wilson of the Marine Corps and Staff Sergeant Marvin “Rex” Young of the Army were both posthumously awarded the Medal of Honor for their heroic actions in the Vietnam War.

subsection.heading: Designation.—
subsection.content: The Department of Veterans Affairs community-based outpatient clinic in Odessa, Texas, shall after the date of the enactment of this Act be known and designated as the “Wilson and Young Medal of Honor VA Clinic”.

subsection.heading: References.—
subsection.content: Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the facility referred to in subsection (b) shall be deemed to be a reference to the “Wilson and Young Medal of Honor VA Clinic”.

signature.role: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.
